intro: Antennaria parlinii, commonly known as Parlin's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant species native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open, dry habitats. Its leaves are spoon-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, while its flowers are usually pale yellow or white. Antennaria parlinii is often found in alpine or arctic regions, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
